sn11.12:1.2: There the Buddha said to the mendicants:
sn11.12:1.3: “Mendicants, in a former life, when Sakka was a human being, he was a student named Magha. That’s why he’s called Maghavā.
sn11.12:2.1: In a former life, when Sakka was a human being, he was first to give gifts. That’s why he’s called Purindada the Firstgiver.
sn11.12:3.1: In a former life, when Sakka was a human being, he gave gifts ably. That’s why he’s called Sakka the Able.
sn11.12:4.1: In a former life, when Sakka was a human being, he gave the gift of a guest house. That’s why he’s called Vāsava the Houser.
sn11.12:5.1: Sakka thinks of a thousand things in an hour. That’s why he’s called Sahassakkha the Thousand-Eyed.
sn11.12:6.1: Sakka’s wife is the titan maiden named Sujā. That’s why he’s called Sujampati, Sujā’s Husband.
sn11.12:7.1: Sakka rules as sovereign lord over the gods of the thirty-three. That’s why he’s called lord of gods.
sn11.12:8.1: In a former life, when Sakka was a human being, he undertook seven vows. And it was because of undertaking these that he achieved the status of Sakka.
sn11.12:8.3: As long as I live, may I support my parents.
sn11.12:8.4: As long as I live, may I honor the elders in the family.
sn11.12:8.5: As long as I live, may I speak gently.
sn11.12:8.6: As long as I live, may I not speak divisively.
sn11.12:8.7: As long as I live, may I live at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.
sn11.12:8.8: As long as I live, may I speak the truth.
sn11.12:8.9: As long as I live, may I be free of anger, or should anger arise, may I quickly get rid of it.
sn11.12:8.10: In a former life, when Sakka was a human being, he undertook seven vows. And it was because of undertaking these that he achieved the status of Sakka.
sn11.12:9.1: A person who respects their parents,
sn11.12:9.2: and honors the elders in the family,
sn11.12:9.3: whose speech is gentle and courteous,
sn11.12:10.1: who’s committed to getting rid of stinginess,
sn11.12:10.2: is truthful, and has mastered anger:
sn11.12:10.4: say they really are a true person.”
